publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Siŋgimduring T II S 48.1

seg.seg: ... together with a woman indicating the way ...
Wenn ein Mönch den Weg nicht kennt [und] eine Frau in der Eigenschaft eines Wegweisers mit ihm geht, [so liegt] kein Vergehen [vor].
If a monk does not know the way [and] a woman goes with him as a guide, [this is ] no offence.
If a monk has lost his way, … [and] he does not find a guide [and] he cannot but go on that road, [and] except for the woman he has no other guide, she … [may guide him].
(If a monk) ordains a person (under twenty), he commits a pātayantika offence. This [person] is not ordained.

If he thinks [lit. if his idea is] «I am not yet twenty years old» or if he is uncertain about it, … and he is not … close to twenty years, and in his mind he decisively has [the idea] «I am twenty years old», and he has nobody to remind him, …

list.item:
Alternative classifications:
Peyrotlate
Malzahn–
TamaiII-1 (600-700)
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2-3 If a monk has lost his way, … [and] he does not find a guide [and] he cannot but go on that road, [and] except for the woman he has no other guide, she … [may guide him]. 698
b2 (If a monk) ordains a person (under twenty), he commits a pātayantika offence. This [person] is not ordained. 692
b4-5 If he thinks [lit. if his idea is] «I am not yet twenty years old» or if he is uncertain about it, … and he is not … close to twenty years, and in his mind he decisively has [the idea] «I am twenty years old», and he has nobody to remind him, … 699

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2 Wenn ein Mönch den Weg nicht kennt [und] eine Frau in der Eigenschaft eines Wegweisers mit ihm geht, [so liegt] kein Vergehen [vor]. 178

Translation THT 330 + THT 1393.c [[Ogihara 2009]]: 383-384:
a1 he says to him, in the same way Pāt. || Pāt. named Abhyākhyāna has come to n end. 9 || If a monk, out of his own wish, a woman /// /// it is not a sin.
a2 If a monk does not know a route and a woman goes with him as guide of the route, it is without sin. If a monk goes astray /// /// it is without sin.
a3 If he does not get a leader and cannot go out except for that route there is no leader for him except a woman, (and if) this woman (goes) as [guide], (it is without sin.) /// /// it should be ... ||
a4 Pāt. named Strīsahagamana has come to an end. 10 || These ten prescriptions of Pāt. are to check the danger pertaining to the possession and to the life. /// /// (If a monk) goes
a5 on the way with a thief, or goes with a toll-stealer, a destroyer of village or a merchant, he commits Pāt. With ... in secret, ... /// /// he goes one Krośa of the ground,
b1 Pāt. In the case of a half Krośa, it is Duṣkṛta. The meaning of the sin should be understood in the same way as (other prescriptions of) Pāt. concerning the route. || (Pāt. named) Steyasaha(gamana has come to an end. 1) /// /// If (a monk) ordains a person under twenty years old,
b2 he commits Pāt. The ordination is not judged as done. (If a monk is) in Upasaṃpadā-place ... /// /// to the person who is ...
b3 it should be done and asked carefully. The one who states the matter should ask him again certainly. As long as the age completely /// /// is ... to him.
b4 If it is the consciousness of this sort to him by himself 'I am never twenty years old', or he is dubious, (or) near twenty years old /// /// he is [not]
b5 twenty years old. It is decisive in his mind in this way 'I am twenty years old.' There is not the person who remembers (his age) to him /// /// it is ... [Twenty years]

a1 – śār weṣṣaṃne ṣemeykne pāyti || abhyākhāṃ ñem payti āra 9 || || ṣamāne ṣañ āymesa klaiñ· /// a2 nesäṃ • ṣamāne ytāri mā aiśtär klīye|klyiye ytāri ṣärpṣūkiññesa yaṃne anāpatti • ṣam(āne y)t(ā)r(i) t(e)triku /// a3 cai mā kallaṃ tā_u ytarimeṃ parna lantsi atameṃ mā campäṃ • klañtsa waipte allek wayauca mā nesaṃne sā_u wa /// a4 strisahagamaṃ ñem pāyti āra 10 || toy śak pāytinta ekaññeṣṣe śaulaṣṣe ñyātse|ñātse taṅktsiś stare tu /// a5 ri yaṃ • waṣik kälpaṣṣukiṃ yoñiyai ṣparkäṣṣukiṃ käryorccempa wat • yaṃ pāyti kättaṅkäṃ • enestaine plataṃkamampa • steyasaṃ /// b1 yaṃ pāyti • ywārtstsa krośne duṣkär • ytāriś milykautsana ṣ pātäntane ṣemeykne se träṅkoṣṣe arth kärsanalle ste || steyasaha /// b2 kwalaññepi waṃsäṃnpāt yāmäṃ pāyti kättaṅkäṃ • su wasaṃnpāt yāmu mā mäsketär • se wasäṃnpāt maññene ma /// b3 pi anaiśai yamaṣṣälle|yamaṣle ste prekṣalle • karmavācakentse|karmavācaṃkentse nano nemcek prekṣalle ste • kos pikwalas solme /// b4 ime taisu tākaṃne ñiś ikäṃ-pikwalaññe mā_uk nesau slaukatstse wat tākaṃ (a)kartte ikäṃ pi /// b5 – m(ā) ste • palskone wätkāltse taisu mäsketärne ikäṃ-pikwalañe nesau • epyaś klaṣṣuki mā nesanne ///
a2 ... together with a woman indicating the way ...

a1 – śār weṣṣaṃne ṣemeykne pāyti || abhyākhāṃ ñem\ payti āra 9 || || ṣamāne ṣañä\ āymesa klaiñ· /// a2 ne_s_aṃ • ṣamāne ytāri mā ai_ś_t_a_r\ klyiye ytāri _ṣ_ar[p]ṣūkiññesa [yaṃ]ne anāpatti • ṣa[m](āne y)t(ā)[r](i) t(e)triku /// a3 cai mā kallaṃ tā_u ytarimeṃ parna lantsi atameṃ mā cam[_p_a]ṃ • klañtsa waipte alle_k\ w[a]yauca mā nesaṃne sā_u wa /// a4 strisahagamaṃ ñe_m\ pāyti āra 10 || toyä\ śa_k\ pāytinta ekaññeṣṣe śaulaṣṣe ñātse taṅktsi_ś\ stare tu /// a5 ri yaṃ • waṣi_k\ _k_alpaṣṣukiṃ yoñiyai ṣpar_k_aṣṣukiṃ _k_aryorccempa wa_t\ • yaṃ pāyti _k_attaṅ_k_aṃ • enestaine plataṃkamampa • steyasaṃ /// b1 yaṃ pāyti • ywārtstsa krośne du_ṣ_k_a_r\ • ytāriś milykautsana ṣ pā_t_antane ṣemeykne se t_r_aṅkoṣṣe arthä\ _k_arsanalle ste || steyasaha /// b2 kwalaññepi waṃ_s_aṃnpāt yā_m_aṃ pāyti _k_attaṅ_k_aṃ • su wasaṃnpāt yāmu mā _m_aske_t_a_r\ • se wa_s_aṃnpāt maññene m[a] /// b3 pi anaiśai yamaṣle ste prekṣalle • karmavācaṃkentse nano nemce_k\ prekṣalle ste • ko_s\ pikwala_s\ solme /// b4 ime taisu tākaṃne ñi_ś\ i_k_aṃ-pikwalaññe mā_uk nesau slaukatstse wa_t\ tākaṃ (a)kartte i_k_aṃ pi /// b5 – m(ā) ste • palskone wätkāltse taisu _m_aske_t_a_rne i_k_aṃ-pikwalañe nesau • epyaś klaṣṣuki mā nesa[nne] ///

div.p:
Alternative classifications:

Translation THT 330 + THT 1393.c <citedRange>383-384</citedRange></bibl>: a1 he says to him, in the same way Pāt. || Pāt. named Abhyākhyāna has come to n end. 9 || If a monk, out of his own wish, a woman /// /// it is not a sin. a2 If a monk does not know a route and a woman goes with him as guide of the route, it is without sin. If a monk goes astray /// /// it is without sin. a3 If he does not get a leader and cannot go out except for that route there is no leader for him except a woman, (and if) this woman (goes) as [guide], (it is without sin.) /// /// it should be ... || a4 Pāt. named Strīsahagamana has come to an end. 10 || These ten prescriptions of Pāt. are to check the danger pertaining to the possession and to the life. /// /// (If a monk) goes a5 on the way with a thief, or goes with a toll-stealer, a destroyer of village or a merchant, he commits Pāt. With ... in secret, ... /// /// he goes one Krośa of the ground, b1 Pāt. In the case of a half Krośa, it is Duṣkṛta. The meaning of the sin should be understood in the same way as (other prescriptions of) Pāt. concerning the route. || (Pāt. named) Steyasaha(gamana has come to an end. 1) /// /// If (a monk) ordains a person under twenty years old, b2 he commits Pāt. The ordination is not judged as done. (If a monk is) in Upasaṃpadā-place ... /// /// to the person who is ... b3 it should be done and asked carefully. The one who states the matter should ask him again certainly. As long as the age completely /// /// is ... to him. b4 If it is the consciousness of this sort to him by himself 'I am never twenty years old', or he is dubious, (or) near twenty years old /// /// he is [not] b5 twenty years old. It is decisive in his mind in this way 'I am twenty years old.' There is not the person who remembers (his age) to him /// /// it is ... [Twenty years] </p></project_comment>
